title: Overall
stimulusHtml:
Note: Answers may argue either side of the question or may be a blend of both.

13-15: Sophisticated analysis of issues; comprehensive argument; well-developed, specific examples; clearly organized; minimal and minor factional errors; clear, well-sustained thesis; must focus on the 1860-1900 period.

10-12: Considerable analysis; clear thesis but less sophistication than in the top category; no major factual errors; must focus on the 1860-1900 period.

7-9: Some analysis but may be primarily descriptive; may have minor confusions in chronology; may have a major factual error.

4-6: Weak analysis; may be an effective rewriting of the question; may contain major factual errors; vague.

1-3: Incoherent, irrelevant, inaccurate; no real sense of the question; no attempt to analyze question.
descriptions: Incoherent, irrelevant, inaccurate; no real sense of the question; no attempt to analyze question.
